question: Zephaniah was a descendent of what Judean king (Zeph 1:1)?
How is the content of the book of Zephaniah described as coming to the prophet Zephaniah (Zeph 1:1)?
choice: The heavens opened and Zephaniah saw
The word of the Lord came to Zephaniah
The Lord anointed Zephaniah as his prophet

question: Zephaniah prophesied during the reign of what king of Judah (Zeph 1:1)?
Josiah was the son of what king of Judah (Zeph 1:1)?
What does the Lord declare he will do to everything on the face of the earth (Zeph 1:2)?
choice: Burn it up with an unquenchable fire

question: The Lord explicitly declares he will sweep away all of the following EXCEPT  (Zeph 1:3)
When God cuts off humans from the face of the earth what will the wicked have (Zeph 1:3)?
choice: Only the shirt on their backs
Only the dust of the earth

question: What will God do to Judah and against all who live in Jerusalem (Zeph 1:4)?
choice: Stand in front of his throne

question: What does the Lord say he will cut off from this place [Jerusalem] (Zeph 1:4)?
Whose names does the Lord declare he will cut off (Zeph 1:4)?
choice: Those who have broken his covenant

question: What do some who will be cut off bow down to on their roofs (Zeph 1:5)?
choice: Animals that crawl on the ground

question: The ones who swear by the Lord’s name and _______’s name will be cut off (Zeph 1:5)?
Who will be cut off (Zeph 1:6)?
choice: Those who believe in lies and oppress the poor
Those who neither seek or inquire of the Lord
Those who plunder the people of the Lord
Those who spurn the temple of the Lord

question: What were the people to be before the Sovereign Lord (Zeph 1:7)?
Who has the Lord consecrated (Zeph 1:7)?
What is near (Zeph 1:7)?
All of the following will be punished on the day of the Lord’s sacrifice EXCEPT (Zeph 1:8)?
On that day who will the Lord punish (Zeph 1:9)?
choice: Those who touch the city gates
Those striking the horns on the altar

question: What do they fill with violence and deceit (Zeph 1:9)?
On that day from what will go up from the Fish Gate (Zeph 1:10)?
Where will wailing come from on that day (Zeph 1:10)?
Who does Zephaniah say will be wiped out (Zeph 1:11)?
Who does Zephaniah tell to wail (Zeph 1:11)?
choice: All who live outside the gate
All who live in the market district

question: What traders will be ruined (Zeph 1:11)?
Where will the Lord search with lamps (Zeph 1:12)?
Who will the Lord punish (Zeph 1:12)?
What do the complacent think (Zeph 1:12)?
choice: It is too hard to follow the Lord
There is no day of the Lord
The idols will save them from the day of the Lord
The Lord will do nothing either good or bad

question: What will the complacent do and not receive the rewards of their efforts (Zeph 1:13)?
choice: They will build houses and not live in them
They will plant olive trees but not harvest any oil
They will walk miles and find no water
They will seek for the Lord but not find him

question: What will the complacent do and not receive the rewards of their efforts (Zeph 1:13)?
choice: They will plant olive trees but not harvest any oil
They will plant vineyards but not drink the wine
They will walk miles and find no water
They will seek for the Lord but not find him

question: What is coming quickly (Zeph 1:14)?
choice: The great day of the Lord

question: Whose bitter shouting will be heard on the great day of the Lord (Zeph 1:14)?
All of the following were used to describe the great day of the Lord EXCEPT (Zeph 1:15)?
choice: Day of trumpet and battle cry

question: In the day of the Lord how will people walk (Zeph 1:17)?
choice: Like a prince before his people
Like a slave with no shoes

question: What will be poured out like dust (Zeph 1:17)?
Why will the Lord bring distress on the people (Zeph 1:17)?
choice: Because they have rebelled against him
Because they have turned their back on him
Because of their idols of gold

question: On the day of the Lord’s wrath what will not be able to save them (Zeph 1:18)?
In what will the whole world be consumed (Zeph 1:18)?
Of what will the Lord make a sudden end (Zeph 1:18)?
choice: All who live in the earth
All who have oppressed the poor
All who turn away from him

question: What does Zephaniah tell the shameful nation to do (Zeph 2:1)?
What did Zephaniah say would sweep on like chaff (Zeph 2:2)?
Who does Zephaniah admonish to seek the Lord (Zeph 2:3)?
choice: Those who have turned from the Lord
All who are humble in the land
All who live on Mount Zion
All those who desire the coming of the great day

question: Why does Zephaniah admonish them to seek righteousness (Zeph 2:3)?
choice: Perhaps the Lord will forgive their iniquity and pardon their rebellion
So that they will be ready to meet their maker
Perhaps they will escape the fury of the Lord in the land of the living
Perhaps they will be sheltered on the day of the Lord’s anger

question: All of the following Philistine cities are mentioned EXCEPT (Zeph 2:4)
What city will be abandoned (Zeph 2:4)?
What were the people of the Philistines by the sea called (Zeph 3:5)?
What did the Lord say to the Philistines of Canaan (Zeph 3:5)?
choice: I will burn your temples with fire
I will destroy you and none will be left
I will carry you off to a foreign land far away
I will bring Egypt up against you

question: What will replace the Kerethites in their land (Zeph 2:6)?
choice: A place for shepherds and sheep pens
A place for farmers plowing and sowing

question: Where do the Kerethites dwell (Zeph 2:6)?
To whom will the land of the Kerethites belong (Zeph 2:7)?
choice: The remnant of the house of Judah
The people of the Negev will inherit it
The exiles of Benjamin will conquer it

question: Where will the remnant of Judah lie down (Zeph 2:7)?
choice: On the high places of Ekron

question: What will the Lord do for the remnant of Judah (Zeph 2:7)?
choice: Bring them back to the land

question: Who had made threats against Zephaniah’s people’s land (Zeph 2:8)?
What did God say Moab would become like (Zeph 2:9)?
God describe the land of Sodom and Gomorrah as all of the following EXCEPT (Zeph 2:9)
Who will inherit the land of the Moabites and Ammonites (Zeph 2:9)?
choice: The exiles of Israel among the nations

question: In return for what would Moab and Ammon be plundered by the remnant of God’s people (Zeph 2:10)?
When will the Lord be awesome to the nations (Zeph 2:11)?
choice: When he destroys all the gods
When he brings Israel back to the land
When he burns the cities of Moab

question: What will the nations on every shore do (Zeph 2:11)?
What will happen to the Cushites (Zeph 2:12)?
choice: They aid the exiles of Judah
They will be slain by the sword
They will be carried into exile

question: What nation will God destroy when he reaches out his hand to the north (Zeph 2:13)?
When God stretches his hand out against Assyria what will Nineveh be like (Zeph 2:13)?
Where will desert owls and screech owls roost at Nineveh (Zeph 2:14)
choice: On the threshold of the city

question: At Nineveh what will be in the doorways (Zeph 2:14)?
What did carefree Nineveh say to herself (Zeph 2:15)?
choice: Who shall bring me down to the ground?
I am the greatest since the beginning of the world
I am, and there is none besides me

question: What do all who pass by do to Nineveh (Zeph 2:15)?
choice: Laugh and dance on her ruins

question: What has Nineveh become (Zeph 2:15)?
Zephaniah gives a woe to the city [Jerusalem] of all of the following EXCEPT (Zeph 3:1)
The city of Jerusalem does not do all of the following EXCEPT (Zeph 3:2)
choice: She does not trust in the Lord
She does not draw near to her God

question: What does Zephaniah liken Jerusalem’s officials to (Zeph 3:3)?
What does Zephaniah liken Jerusalem’s rulers to (Zeph 3:3)?
What characteristics does Zephaniah attribute to Jerusalem’s prophets (Zeph 3:4)?
How does Zephaniah characterize Jerusalem’s priests (Zeph 3:4)?
How does Zephaniah characterize Jerusalem’s priests (Zeph 3:4)?
choice: They do violence to the law

question: What does the Lord dispense morning by morning (Zeph 3:5)?
What does the Lord do every day (Zeph 3:5)?
What do the unrighteous not know (Zeph 3:5)?
What does the Lord say he has cut off (Zeph 3:6)?
What has the Lord left deserted (Zeph 3:6)?
What two things does the Lord tell Jerusalem it must do not to be cut off (Zeph 3:7)?
choice: Seek the Lord and walk in his ways
Purify his sanctuary and put on sackcloth

question: What were the residents of Jerusalem eager to do in all they did (Zeph 3:7)?
Why is the Lord gathering the nations (Zeph 3:8)?
choice: To teach them the ways of the Lord
To pour out his wrath on them
To give them over to the one smiting
To bring them to Mount Zion

question: With what will the whole world be consumed (Zeph 3:9)?
choice: Famine and drought all over the global
The fire of God’s jealous anger

question: What will the Lord do for the peoples (Zeph 3:9)?
choice: Strike them down with an iron rod

question: Why will the Lord purify the lips of the peoples (Zeph 3:9)?
choice: So that they may call on the name of the Lord
So that they may believe on the Lord Almighty
So that they will turn from their sins
So that they will walk in his ways

question: What will the peoples do shoulder to shoulder (Zeph 3:9)?
choice: Block the opening of the gates

question: For beyond what area will God’s scattered people bring offerings (Zeph 3:10)?
Who will God remove from this city (Zeph 3:11)?
choice: The unrighteous who have oppressed the poor
Those who rejoice in their pride

question: Who will never again be on God’s holy hill (Zeph 3:11)?
Who will be left within you (Zeph 3:12)?
Who will be left within you (Zeph 3:12)?
choice: The righteous who follow in the ways of the Lord
Those who trust in the name of the Lord

question: In whose mouths will not be found any deceit (Zeph 3:13)?
choice: The righteous who dwell in the land

question: What will happen after the remnant eats (Zeph 3:13)?
choice: They will lie down and no one will make them afraid
Each will rest under his own vine
They will harvest figs from their own trees
Their swords will be beat into plowshares

question: Who does Zephaniah exhort to sing (Zeph 3:14)?
Why should the daughter of Jerusalem be glad and rejoice (Zeph 3:15)?
choice: The Lord has consecrated your land
The Lord has cleansed your heart
The Lord has taken away your punishment
The Lord has forgiven your sins

question: Why should the daughter of Jerusalem be glad and rejoice (Zeph 3:15)?
choice: The Lord has consecrated your land
The Lord has cleansed your heart
The Lord has forgiven your sins
The Lord has turned back your enemy

question: What will never happen again because the King of Israel is with them (Zeph 3:15)?
choice: They will never again fear any harm
They will never again be exiled from their land
Jerusalem will never again be destroyed
They will never again serve foreign gods

question: On that day what will they say to Jerusalem (Zeph 3:16)?
choice: No terror shall ever enter you again
Zion is the Lord’s dwelling forever

question: What is the Lord mighty to do (Zeph 3:17)?
With what will the Lord quiet Israel (Zeph 3:17)?
What will the Lord their God do over them (Zeph 3:17)?
choice: Shine like the sun in his righteousness

question: What does the Lord say he will remove from them (Zeph 3:18)?
choice: The enemy from a foreign land
The mildew and locusts that have plagued them

question: Who does the Lord say he will rescue (Zeph 3:19)?
Where will the Lord give them praise and honor (Zeph 3:19)?
choice: On all the hills of Judea where they were carried into exile
In the valleys of the Arabah
In every land where they were put to shame

question: What will the Lord do at that time (Zeph 3:20)?
What will the Lord give them among all the peoples of the earth (Zeph 3:20)?
